meanings.definition: In a way that lacks logical reasoning or coherence.
meanings.sent1: She acted illogically by jumping into the pool fully clothed.
meanings.sent2: He spoke illogically when he claimed the sky was made of cheese.
meanings.sent3: The cat illogically tried to catch its own tail, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The idea of flying without wings seemed illogically impossible to the young child.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle was solved illogically by randomly guessing the answer.

meanings.sent1: The illogical decision to wear a winter coat in summer left her sweating.
meanings.sent2: It was an illogical choice to use a fork to eat soup.
meanings.sent3: The illogical banana peel made the monkey slip and slide comically.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like a jumbled, illogical mess after staying up all night.
meanings.sent5: The illogical pattern of the maze confused the participants.
